extractions.description: This paper discusses the implementation and assessment of a global pediatric trauma course in Brazil, focusing on trauma resuscitation in kids. The study explores the feasibility of this course in a middle-income country and evaluates its performance and impact on teaching pediatric trauma management skills.

type.justification: The paper utilizes practical methods such as simulation and statistical analysis to assess the feasibility and effectiveness of the trauma course, indicative of empirical research.
type.quote: "We administered a knowledge test before and after the course and a postcourse self-evaluation. We recorded each simulation to assess participantsâ€™ performance, reflected in a team performance score."

name.justification: The study focuses on the implementation of a pediatric trauma course, emphasizing training and education within a medical context.
name.quote: "In Brazil, where trauma is the leading cause of death for children over age 1, we piloted the first global adaptation of the Trauma Resuscitation in Kids (TRIK) course and assessed its feasibility."

name.justification: The research also pertains to global health by addressing trauma training in a global context and achieving equitable healthcare education in low- and middle-income countries.
name.quote: "Over 90% of pediatric trauma deaths occur in low- and middle-income coun-tries (LMICs), yet pediatric trauma-focused training remains unstandardized and inacces-sible, especially in LMICs."
